intro: Chilenia reichei, commonly known as the Chilean sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Chile. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid and coastal climates of its native habitat. Chilenia reichei is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
